column4: Yahoo investors are U.S. tax-reform skeptics
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Yahoo will soon be little more than a holding company for stakes in Alibaba and Yahoo Japan. The $52 billion internet firm's shareholders on Thursday approved the sale of its operating businesses to Verizon Communications for $4.5 billion. The long-standing wrinkle  though  is that Yahoo bought the minority holdings so cheaply that essentially the entire value of both would be taxable in the United States if it sold them.
